DOC.criteria: Healthy male subject determine result screen Signed write informed consent accordance Good Clinical Practice ( GCP ) local legislation Age > = 18 < = 50 year BMI > 18.5 < 29.9 kg/m2 ( Body Mass Index ) Any find medical examination ( include blood pressure , pulse rate , electrocardiogram ) deviate normal clinical relevance Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunologic , haematological , oncological hormonal disorder Surgery gastrointestinal tract ( except appendectomy ) Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder Relevant history orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Chronic relevant acute infection History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Intake drug long halflife ( > 24 hour ) ( < 1 month prior administration trial ) Use drug might influence result trial ( < 10 day prior study drug administration expect trial ) Participation another trial investigational drug ( < 2 month prior administration expect trial ) Smoker ( > 10 cigarette > 3 cigar > 3 pipes/day ) Inability refrain smoke trial day Alcohol abuse ( > 60 g/day ) Drug abuse Blood donation loss > 400 mL , < 1 month prior administration expect trial Excessive physical activity ( within 5 day prior administration trial ) Clinically relevant laboratory abnormality Any electrocardiogram value outside reference range clinical relevance include , limited QRS interval > 110 m QTcB > 450 m QT > 500 m Known hypersensitivity drug excipients Inability comply dietary regimen study centre Inability comply investigator 's instruction
